review: I absolutely love this!  I was hesitant about purchasing the Fire TV coming from a Roku 2 due to the negative reviews about the remote.  I will state that I have changed the batteries in the remote on average every week to four days depending on usage.  The ONLY negative part of the Fire TV is the battery drain of the remote.  If Amazon could come up with a better remote design that does not drain the batteries and send it to all of us who purchased the Fire TV then that would make it even better.  The smooth operation and the voice control is amazing.  The quality and clarity of the playback is amazing.  When the Fire TV goes to sleep I love that is has a screensaver mode and it is calm and soothing to wake up to in the morning after having fallen asleep with the Fire TV on.  I did purchase a couple of game apps for my 10 yo daughter, one of which requires the NOT INCLUDED game controller (addtl. $40).  I have not purchased the additional controller as of yet, but I am getting ready to look at the reviews for it.  Purchase the Fire TV, you will not be sorry!  Just stock up on batteries for the remote!
author: Amazon Customer

review: We have three Amazon Fire devices and love them. We ditched cable and switched to this platform for entertainment. The device itself is so simple to connect and set up. It's also small and sleek and not as clunky as cable boxes. It works seamlessly with various apps. One thing to note is that the voice search does not search through all apps to find what you're looking for. It's limited to Amazon Prime selections and HuluPlus, but it's still a useful feature, and my 6yo loves being able to search for programs without punching in letters since he's a beginning speller. There are also good parental controls on the device to filter programming as necessary or to block kiddos from making in-app purchases. We took a chance giving up cable, but we've never regretted it.
